intro: Gomphocarpus meliodorus, commonly known as the yellow starbursts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble starbursts. The plant produces a unique capsule fruit that splits open to release its seeds. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats.
